description: From Hindi शीरशक्कर (śīrśakkar), from Persian شیر و شکر‎ (šir o šekar, literally “milk and sugar”), modified by folk etymology, originally alluding to the smooth (“milk”) and rough (“sugar”) surface of the stripes.

entries.meaning: (textiles) A thin, all-cotton fabric, commonly striped, used to make clothing for summer wear.
(countable) An article made from such fabric.
